info.title: CoolerControl Daemon API
info.description: Basic OpenAPI documentation for the CoolerControl Daemon API

get.description: A simple endpoint to verify the connection
Returns a Health Check Status.

400.description: Bad Request. The request is invalid

404.description: Whatever you're looking for, it's not here.

502.description: Bad Gateway. An error has occurred with an external library.

get.description: This returns all recent main daemon logs as raw text

post.description: This acknowledges existing log warnings and errors, and sets a timestamp of when this occurred

400.description: Bad Request. The request is invalid

404.description: Whatever you're looking for, it's not here.

502.description: Bad Gateway. An error has occurred with an external library.

post.description: Sends a cancellation signal to shut the daemon down. When the daemon is running as a systemd or initrc service, it is automatically restarted.

get.description: Subscribes and returns the Server Sent Events for a Log stream
Subscribes and returns the Server Sent Events for a Status stream
Subscribes and returns the Server Sent Events for a ModeActivated stream
Subscribes and returns Events for when an Alert State has changed

CookieAuth.name: cc
CookieAuth.description: The private session cookie used for authentication.

BasicAuth.description: HTTP Basic authentication, mostly used to generate a secure authentication cookie.

warmup_duration.description:
Time in seconds throughout which the alert conditidon must hold before the alert is
 activated

oneOf.description:
Alert condition was satisfied at the stored time but the duration threshold has not been
 reached
Represents an error state. e.g. when one of the components in the alert isn't found.

extension.description: Specialized settings (extensions) that apply to a specific device channel.

CCDeviceSettings.description: Device Specific settings that generally apply to how the application deals with the device.

channel_settings.description: A list of channels specific settings, including disable and extension settings.

disable.description: All communication with this device will be avoided if disabled

name.description: The device name for this setting. Helpful after blacklisting(disabling) devices.

ChannelExtensionNames.description:
Channel extension names that signal which `ChannelExtensions` are applicable
 for a particular device channel.

ChannelExtensions.description:
Device Channel specific settings
 This is used to store specialized settings (extensions) that apply to a specific device channel.

anyOf.description: Whether to use the device channel's internal hardware fan curve functionality.

Whether to use the AMDGPU RDNA3/4 features.
 It allows the device to run at zero RPM when the temperature is below a certain threshold.

hw_fan_curve_enabled.description:
Whether to use the internal HW Curve feature, instead of setting regular
 flat curves. Using this reduces functionality.

ChannelSource.description:
A source for displaying sensor data that is related to a particular channel.
 This is like `TempSource` but not limited to temperature sensors. (Load, Duty, etc.)

channel_name.description: The internal name for this channel source. NOT the Label.

device_uid.description: The associated device uid containing current values

children.description:
The Custom Sensor's children, if any.

 Each Custom Sensor is either a child, parent, or standalone, not a combination of those.
 Custom Sensors are limited to 1 level of hierarchy. This removes the possibility
 of circular references.

 The children and parents vectors are managed and filled internally. For GET endpoints,
 they provide this information for clients. For POST or PUT endpoints,
 any values here are essentially ignored.

id.description: ID MUST be unique, as `temp_name` must be unique.

parents.description: The Custom Sensor's parents, if any. See `children` for more details.

temp_max.description: The absolute maximum temp to use for Profiles for this device

temp_min.description: The absolute minimum temp to use for Profiles for this device

thinkpad_fan_control.description:
When present, then this is a `ThinkPad` device. True or False indicates whether Fan control
 is enabled for the kernel module and changing values is possible

locations.description:
If available various paths used to access the device.
 This can include paths like the kernel device path, hwmon path, HID path, or PCI Bus ID

name.description: If available the kernel driver name or liquidctl driver class.

version.description:
If available the driver's version.
 For kernel-based drivers this is the current kernel version.
 For liquidctl-based drivers this is the liquidctl version.
 For Nvidia-based drivers this is the version of the installed nvidia proprietary drivers.

DriverType.description: The Driver Type, or source of the driver actively being used for this device.

deviance.description: The temperature deviance threshold in degrees

duty_maximum.description: The maximum duty change to apply

duty_minimum.description: The minimum duty change to apply

name.description: The user given name for this function

only_downward.description: Whether to apply settings only on the way down

sample_window.description: The sample window this function should use, particularly applicable to moving averages

uid.description: The Unique identifier for this function

driver_type.description: An Enum representation of the various Liquidctl driver classes

firmware_version.description: The detected firmware version at initialization

unknown_asetek.description: An indicator for needed user input to determine actual asetek690lc device

LcdCarouselSettings.description:
Settings for the LCD Carousel.

 This can be used to have a carousel of images (static or gif), of sensor data,
 or a combination of both.

images_path.description:
The absolute path directory location for images for the carousel. All applicable images
 present are processed when the setting is applied.

interval.description: The interval in seconds (2-900) in which to change images in the carousel.

colors.description: a list of RGB tuple values, eg [(20,20,120), (0,0,255)]

image_file_processed.description: The LCD Image processed file path location, where the preprocessed image is located.

temp_source.description: A temp source for displaying a temperature.

colors.description: a list of RGB tuple values, eg [(20,20,120), (0,0,255)]

function_uid.description: The function uid to apply to this profile

member_profile_uids.description: The profiles that make up the mix profile

mix_function_type.description: The function to mix the members with if this is a Mix Profile

name.description: The User given name for this Profile

offset_profile.description:
The graph offset to apply to the associated member profile
 This can also be used as a static offset when there is only one duty/offset pair.

speed_fixed.description: The fixed duty speed to set. eg: 20 (%)

speed_profile.description: The profile temp/duty speeds to set. eg: [(20.0, 50), (25.7, 80)]

temp_max.description: The maximum temp for this profile

temp_min.description: The minimum temp for this profile

uid.description: The Unique Identifier for this Profile

Setting.description:
Setting is used to store applied Settings to a device channel.
 These are the general core settings that apply to a wide range of device and channel types.
 Specialized settings are stored in `DeviceExtensions` and `ChannelExtensions`.
 Only one specific lighting or speed setting is applied to a specific channel at a time.

profile_uid.description: The Profile UID that applies to this device channel

reset_to_default.description: Used to set hwmon & nvidia channels back to their default 'automatic' values.

speed_fixed.description: The fixed duty speed to set. eg: 20 (%)

extension.description: If present, then this channel has special settings that are applicable.

fixed_enabled.description: True if manual fan speed control is supported; if false, speeds are read-only (monitoring only).

max_duty.description: The maximum fan duty for this speed channel

min_duty.description: The minimum fan duty for this speed channel

Status.description: A Model which contains various applicable device statuses

device_uid.description: The associated device uid containing current temp values

temp_name.description: The internal name for this Temperature Source. NOT the `TempInfo` Label.
